intro: Heliohebe raoulii subsp. maccaskillii, commonly known as the Maccaskill heliohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a red or purple throat. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
